title.narrative: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING FOR IMPROVED GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: National authorities, in partnership with relevant stakeholders, have the capacity to generate, analyse and use relevant disaggregated data and knowledge on child rights issues for evidence-based policies and monitoring., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: National policies affecting children and adolescents and their families (especially those from Roma communities and those with disabilities) are evidence-based, equitable and adequately financed.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National authorities, in partnership with relevant stakeholders, have the capacity to generate, analyse and use relevantdisaggregated data and knowledge on child rights issues for evidence-based policies and monitoring.

description.narrative: UNICEF;ensured a robust;monitoring ofthe situation of children, both through;its ‘Situation Analysis of Children and Adolescents in Romania’and its assessment of thesocio-economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on children and families, both of which focused on the most vulnerable children.Support was provided for development of an action plan for Romania’s 2030 sustainable development strategy.At the local level, child rights monitoring and implementation received support through the child-friendly cities initiative. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022

title.narrative: Quality evidence and analysis on key child issues are generated on time by UNICEF(51692)
Independent National Human Rights Institution (NHRI) is in place in compliance with the Paris Principles with a child rights mandate(51691)
data on children disaggregated by rural/urban, gender, age, disability, ethnicity and income quintile(51690)
